title: Image Analysis Using Imaris 10.1 Machine Learning to Quantitate Î³H2AX Foci in U87 Cells
content: Glioblastoma (GBM) is an aggressive form of cancer and is becoming increasingly prevalent in the population. Each year an estimated 13,140 people are diagnosed in just the United States alone, and of those patients, roughly 10,000 people will die from the disease [1]. The mean survival time of GBM patients lies between 12-18 months, and the five-year survival rate is only 6.8% [1]. The main treatment options for these malignant tumors remain aggressive surgical resections and radiation treatments with chemotherapy [2]. Yet even with these treatments, GBM has a very high treatment resistance and the patient survival and mortality rates have remained unchanged for the past 30 years [1].
